intro: Silene colorata var. distachya, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and branching. Silene colorata var. distachya is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its colorful and often showy flowers.
